issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

Application type: desktop
Titanium SDK: 3.2.0.GA
Titanium Studio: build: 3.2.0.201312191547 Build: jenkins-titanium-rcp-master-76 (origin/master) Date: 19 December 2013, 15:48:53
Host Operating System: Linux Mint 16
Platform & version: Android SDK: 16
Device: Android Emulator
a simple test case: any code(ex default Alloy "Hello World")
fields.summary: Android: Longjohn Error on every emulator start

comments.body: There is really not much information in this ticket to diagnose this issue. Please provide us a simple Titanium test case, Android SDK version and emulator information to troubleshoot this issue.

I tested this on 64-bit Linux Mint 15 with Node.js 0.10.25, Titanium SDK 3.2.0.GA, and Android SDK 4.4 and was unable to reproduce.

I suspect that adb was having a bad day. You can try running {{adb kill-server}} and restarting the Android emulator. You may even need to recreate the Android emulator. Be sure to keep your Android platform and build tools up to date with the latest versions.

In the meantime, I'll submit a PR that will convert the Buffer to a String which should resolve the error you are receiving.

Master pull request: https://github.com/appcelerator/titanium_mobile/pull/5278
3.2.x pull request: https://github.com/appcelerator/titanium_mobile/pull/5279

I'm not sure how to test given that I cannot reproduce the problem. I suspect this has to do with the Node.js version you have installed.
Thanks a lot! It fixed my problem!

Yes. it fixed for me too. Fedora Linux AMD64, SDK 3.2.1 GA and Android SDK 4.1.2
nodejs  0.10.24

I am able to reproduce this issue on Nexus 5 phone , android version:4.4.2
It works fine on Nexus 4, android version: 4.1.2
Log file is attached as error.txt

Environment used:
Device: Nexus 5 phone , android version:4.4.2
Appcelerator Studio, build: 3.2.1.201402061120
SDK: 3.2.0.GA
alloy: 1.3.1-Beta
acs: 1.0.11
npm: 1.3.2
titanium: 3.2.0.GA
titanium-code-processor: 1.1.0
OS: Ubuntu 12.04 (64-bit) LTS

Tested on:
Ubuntu 14.04 (64-bit) LTS
Appcelerator Studio, build: 3.2.1.201402061120
Titanium SDK, build: 3.2.1.GA
Titanium SDK, build: 3.2.0.GA
CLI: 3.2.1
Alloy: 1.3.1

Cannot reproduce this error.
Android Emulator successfully launches on each run attempt.
Going to re-mark this as fixed based on [~sdowse]'s comments

Verified fix using below environment:

Appc Studio: 3.2.3.201403190645
Sdk: 3.2.3.v20140322210914
acs: 1.0.14
npm: 1.3.2
alloy:1.3.1
titanium:3.2.1
titanium-code-processor:1.1.0
Xcode: 5.1
Osx: Ubuntu 12.04 (64-bit) LTS
Device: Nexus 5 phone , android version:4.4.2

Emulator launches successfully on each run without any error message.
